Post_Title: "Why are you handling lock down so well?" I trained for this my entire adolescence.
post_text:
Constantly stressed that one slip-up would do irreparable damage? Check.

Never being able to socialize with my peers? Check. 

A steady flow of gaslighting? Check. 

Staying inside? Check.

Always worrying about apparel (Mask)? Oh yeah. Check.

My husband didn't understand how I managed to be as functional as I have been for as long as I have been, but this was *my entire life* from age seven to eighteen.

The look on his face was a complicated mixture of horror and grief and then he held me for a while.

EDIT: I'm a little blown away by the response to this. Please understand that I may not have responded individually to you but I see you, and you're not alone. Thank you for the awards and the solidarity.

Threads.Reply_Text: Your parents ruin your mental health and you end up staying at home all the time because you're too depressed to go anywhere? Check.

Replies.Reply_Text: And in turn I will never belong anywhere and will die alone but crave attention from absolutely any source? Check and check.

>And in turn I will never belong anywhere and will die alone but crave attention from absolutely any source?

Ouch! I can relate to that one!
Sorry about that one

That can get much better. I was in that mindset through most of college, where I had just enough interaction with my parents to keep me hopeless. It is super hard to get up and get going, but once you do it gets easier because you get positive reinforcement.

Of course, I'm totally screwed up right now with the covid situation, but once it's over it's just a matter of putting the work in to get back to being ok. I recommend starting with a group relating to a hobby. Then you just casually go talk about the hobby and eventually become full friends, less pressure than specifically trying to "meet people."

With a bit of luck and more hard work is fair, you can find a place to belong and people who really love you.
Except it can't get better. I'm at the peak of my life right now and suicide literally is my only way out.

I'm sorry you're at such a desperate place, and please know you're not alone in those feelings. If it helps at all, abuse tends to warp your understanding of reality and set up mental barriers where no physical ones exist. I hope you can find some support to help ease the burden and get to a place of wellness, but I know from first hand experience how horribly difficult and unfair to have to slog through that kind of pain.

I don't know your situation, but speaking for myself and many others, things improve considerably when you are able to put physical and emotional distance between yourself and the narcs. If you haven't been able to do that yet, it's a change that's worth holding out for.
[removed]

Ever considered therapy? I am in mid 30s and went No Contact a bit more than a year ago with my NMother and my EStepfather and I am starting to heal. I was really depressive since my childhood and thought I would kill myself one day, but o wonder I am clinging to live really bad and I have my own family now even though I never thought I would have and that everything will end in shite. Going NC is often the only way out. And you should look for therapy. You are worth it.

Did you downvote me because I tried to be nice? But yeah, you really do talk like a narcissist. I am sorry you feel so bad about yourself. And therapy can help if you find a therapist you can trust, not everyone might be the right one for you but there are really good people out there. If you want help you can go look for them. Since you call it a scam I assume you live in the U.S. because you seem to have to pay for therapy and don't have access to universal healthcare? I hope you can get help anyway. Well, at least if you want to.

CHECK CHECK
Yep this is me
And now its the same parents telling you you should go out of the house and do something in the middle of a fucking pandemic.

You give up trying to have friends because nparents always come up with absurd reasons why they are supposedly awful people and should not be around you, but don't outright ban you from interacting with them. No, they have to wear you down with it or humiliate you before those people.

Don't forget the gaslighting. Your friends aren't who they seem to be.

Or they'll use them against you. Why can't you be like your friends?

Or they'll just blame you for not having friends. Why don't you have friends? I don't know mum and dad perhaps it has something to do with the fact that you fucked me up as I grew up and my ability to trust other people is so diminished that I only trust my own therapist.
Same!
They may have harmed it, but it's never ruined. Recovery is an option now, if you are safely away from them. Or even if you're not. Therapy was a life changer for me.

i agree 100% and have had the same experience, I feel almost unrecognizable from just two years ago (when I started therapy) whats odd is I actually recognize myself for the first time and thatâ€™s the difference, before I had no idea of self and was so lost trying to find it in others. Recovery for me is finding myself in myself, seeing myself as a complete person not to be someone else for them

My mom has strived to be more of a best friend rather than a "mom." It is a game-changer, her ideas and beliefs affect me as any other friends would, and I still have plenty of clarity of what I truly want.
